document_data.name: Market Ward
document_data.mainbody: The '''Market Ward''' was the locale that housed most of [[Port Nyanzaru]]'s mercantile businesses and shops, along with residences of its tradespeople.
document_data.Description:
The Market Ward comprised the eastern part of the walled portion of Port Nyanzaru, abutting the [[Port Nyanzaru/Harbor Ward|Harbor Ward]] to the west and sitting atop a ridge overlooking the [[Bay of Chult]].{{Cite adventurers league/A City on the Edge|15}} Modest residences and a myriad of businesses and crafting houses were built in large clusters{{Cite adventurers league/A City on the Edge|33}} around and up two hills: [[Mount Sibasa]] to the northeast—topped by the [[Hall of Gold]]{{Cite adventurers league/A Lesson in Love|6}} including some fancier villas 

The ward was typically bustling with activity,{{Cite adventurers league/A City on the Edge|42}}

Notable Locations.Landmarks:
:;[[Dye works (Port Nyanzaru)|Dye works]]: The craftspeople of Port Nyanzaru produced the vividly-colorful garments and textiles that were so beloved among the [[Chultan (ethnicity)|Chultan]] people.
:;[[Grand Coliseum]]: The grand arena of the city held bloody mock battles, extravagant tournaments and holiday celebrations. It sat atop Yklwazi Hill.
:;[[Public bathhouse (Port Nyanzaru)|Public Bathhouse]]: An egalitarian and elegant bathhouse operated by the [[church of Sune]] and open to all. It sat in the north of the ward overlooking the sea.
:;[[Tiryki Gate]]: The gate that connected the Market Ward to [[Port Nyanzaru/Tiryki Anchorage|Tiryki Anchorage]] outside the walls of the city.
:;[[Ubtao's Jaws]]: The gate that connected the Market Ward to the slums of [[Malar's Throat]] outside the walls of the city.
Notable Locations.Markets:
:;[[Fish market (Port Nyanzaru)|Fish market]]: This locale was the best place to purchase the freshest catch of the day. The selection was better in the morning, and the prices were higher accordingly.
:;[[Red Bazaar]]: The folk of Port Nyanzaru bought their daily needs and sold their goods in this marketplace.
Notable Locations.Temples: :;[[Hall of Gold]]: The city's magnificent temple of [[Waukeen]] was situated atop Mount Sibasa.

Inhabitants.Notable Inhabitants:
* [[Alastar Bol]], a representative of the [[Order of the Gauntlet]] who lived in a fancy villa near the wall at the top of Mount Sibasa.
* [[Flight of Fancy]], a [[tabaxi]] [[jeweler]] who lived and had a shop near the Hall of Gold.
* [[Omala]], a master colorist at the dye works.
* [[Mowbula Utakulu]], a bookie for the city's dinosaur races and a [[Harper]] sympathizer.{{Cite adventurers league/A Day at the Races|4}}
* The [[Underbridge]]s, a [[Chondathan]] family with three pet [[velociraptor]]s who lived atop Mount Sibasa.

document_data.History:
In the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], the Market Ward served as the beginning and ending point for a new kind of [[dinosaur race]] known as [[Na N'buso's Haka]].{{Cite adventurers league/A Day at the Races|6}}

During the events of the [[death curse]], the Market Ward was briefly overrun by the forces of the [[devil|infernal]] pirate captain [[Idrianne Smoke]].{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|4}}{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|24}} The defense of the ward was led personally by the [[merchant princes (Port Nyanzaru)|merchant prince]] [[Ekene-Afa]].
